title: How to Make a High Fiber Smoothie

methods.name: Making a Smoothie with Pears and Beets

steps.headline: Add the water and ice first.
steps.description: When making a smoothie, it's always best to add the liquids first. This will help the smoothie blend quicker. Add your water and ice to the blender first. Use cold water if you want a cooler smoother. If you usually drink filtered water, it's best to use filtered water in your smoothie.

steps.headline: Clean and chop your fruit.
steps.description: Run your fruit beets and bears under the faucet in your kitchen. Make sure to rotate them to remove any dirt. Then, chop  your fruit into pieces, removing cores and seeds. If you don't have a very strong blender, opt for smaller pieces. These will blend more easily.

steps.headline: Add your ingredients.
steps.description: Add the remaining ingredients to the blender. Add your fruit first and then your almonds and hemp seed. If your blender is not very strong, you may want to crush your almonds first. Place the almonds in a plastic bag and roll a rolling pin over them until they're crushed.

steps.headline: Blend until smooth.
steps.description: It's best to start off at a low setting. Then, gradually increase until the contents mix together. Keep blending your smoothie until there are no more big chunks of fruit and it reaches the consistency you like.

steps.headline: Add the coconut water and ice.
steps.description: Liquids should go first. This  will make your smoothie blend more easily. Measure out your coconut water and ice and then add them to the blender.

steps.headline: Place the produce in the blender.
steps.description: From there, add your produce. Make sure to wash your kale under running water first. It's a good idea to break your grapefruit into segments before adding it to the blender, especially if you have a weaker blender. This will make it blend more easily. You may also want to break your banana up into smaller pieces.

steps.headline: Add the pomegranate powder.
steps.description: Add the powder last. Measure it out and sprinkle it over the other ingredients.

steps.headline: Blend until smooth.
steps.description: Start at a low setting and gradually increase the speed. Keep blending until there are no big chunks of fruit left an the smoothie is at the consistency you want. How long this will take depends on the precise strength of your blender, which can vary.

methods.name: Making a High Fiber Broccoli Smoothie

steps.headline: Add the pomegranate juice.
steps.description: Liquids should always go in first. Measure out your pomegranate juice and add it to the blender. When selecting pomegranate juice at the store, make sure it's 100% juice. Juice from concentrate tends to have a lot of added sugar and less fiber.

steps.headline: Add the other ingredients.
steps.description: You should wash your broccoli and and cherries before adding them to the blender. If your cherries have pits, remove them. Add the fruit and remaining ingredients to the blender. If you have a weaker blender, it's a good idea to chop up the banana first.

steps.headline: Blend at a high speed.
steps.description: This smoothie should actually be blended at the highest speed possible. This is because broccoli can be difficult to break down in a blender. It may take slightly longer to blend this smoothie to a smooth consistency than it would with other smoothies.

methods.name: Trying a Vegan Chocolate Hemp Smoothie

steps.headline: Add the coconut powder and ice cubes.
steps.description: Always add the liquids first. This encourages the smoothie to blend quicker. Measure out your ice cubes and coconut powder and throw them in the bottom of your blender.

steps.headline: Place your banana in the blender.
steps.description: The fruit should go in next. If you have a weaker blender, peel your banana and break it into segments before adding it to the blender.

steps.headline: Add the powders.
steps.description: You should add the powders after the fruit. Measure out the hemp or protein powder and the cocoa powder. Add them to the blender. If you're looking to up your protein intake, it's a good idea to use protein powder over hemp powder.

steps.headline: Blend until smooth.
steps.description: Start at a low speed and gradually work your way up. Keep blending until all the ingredients are blended together in a smooth fashion. Time varies depending on the strength of your blender.

text: Making a Smoothie with Pears and Beets Add the water and ice first. When making a smoothie, it's always best to add the liquids first. This will help the smoothie blend quicker. Add your water and ice to the blender first. Use cold water if you want a cooler smoother. If you usually drink filtered water, it's best to use filtered water in your smoothie. Clean and chop your fruit. Run your fruit beets and bears under the faucet in your kitchen. Make sure to rotate them to remove any dirt. Then, chop  your fruit into pieces, removing cores and seeds. If you don't have a very strong blender, opt for smaller pieces. These will blend more easily. Add your ingredients. Add the remaining ingredients to the blender. Add your fruit first and then your almonds and hemp seed. If your blender is not very strong, you may want to crush your almonds first. Place the almonds in a plastic bag and roll a rolling pin over them until they're crushed. Blend until smooth. It's best to start off at a low setting. Then, gradually increase until the contents mix together. Keep blending your smoothie until there are no more big chunks of fruit and it reaches the consistency you like. Creating a Pomegranate Grapefruit Smoothie Add the coconut water and ice. Liquids should go first. This  will make your smoothie blend more easily. Measure out your coconut water and ice and then add them to the blender. Place the produce in the blender. From there, add your produce. Make sure to wash your kale under running water first. It's a good idea to break your grapefruit into segments before adding it to the blender, especially if you have a weaker blender. This will make it blend more easily. You may also want to break your banana up into smaller pieces. Add the pomegranate powder. Add the powder last. Measure it out and sprinkle it over the other ingredients. Blend until smooth. Start at a low setting and gradually increase the speed. Keep blending until there are no big chunks of fruit left an the smoothie is at the consistency you want. How long this will take depends on the precise strength of your blender, which can vary. Making a High Fiber Broccoli Smoothie Add the pomegranate juice. Liquids should always go in first. Measure out your pomegranate juice and add it to the blender. When selecting pomegranate juice at the store, make sure it's 100% juice. Juice from concentrate tends to have a lot of added sugar and less fiber. Add the other ingredients. You should wash your broccoli and and cherries before adding them to the blender. If your cherries have pits, remove them. Add the fruit and remaining ingredients to the blender. If you have a weaker blender, it's a good idea to chop up the banana first. Blend at a high speed. This smoothie should actually be blended at the highest speed possible. This is because broccoli can be difficult to break down in a blender. It may take slightly longer to blend this smoothie to a smooth consistency than it would with other smoothies. Trying a Vegan Chocolate Hemp Smoothie Add the coconut powder and ice cubes. Always add the liquids first. This encourages the smoothie to blend quicker. Measure out your ice cubes and coconut powder and throw them in the bottom of your blender. Place your banana in the blender. The fruit should go in next. If you have a weaker blender, peel your banana and break it into segments before adding it to the blender. Add the powders. You should add the powders after the fruit. Measure out the hemp or protein powder and the cocoa powder. Add them to the blender. If you're looking to up your protein intake, it's a good idea to use protein powder over hemp powder. Blend until smooth. Start at a low speed and gradually work your way up. Keep blending until all the ingredients are blended together in a smooth fashion. Time varies depending on the strength of your blender.
